repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Bogota Urban Transport Project;
            Antioquia Education Project; Cartagena Water Supply,
            Sewerage and Environmental Management Project - proposed
            amendment to the loan agreement

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed amendment to the Loan
            Agreement will provide the department of Antioquia, the
            municipality of Bogota and the municipality of Cartagena,
            and the Republic of Colombia with access to IBRD's
            financial products for the purpose of managing the interest
            rate and currency exposure they currently have as a result
            of their US Dollar-denominated variable spread loans (VSL).
            The proposed amendments will allow the Borrowers to: (i)
            convert the currency of denomination of the loans; (ii)
            change the interest rate basis of the loans from floating
            rate to fixed rate and vice versa; and (iii) place a cap or
            a collar on the interest rate applicable to the loans.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and institutional development impacts
            are substantial. Lessons provided herewith from the project
            experience, basically reinforce the need for dissemination
            of information; for diagnostic studies, and analyses,
            particularly when undergoing profound sectoral
            transformation; strong technical assistance to achieve
            coordinated actions; empowering the educational community; a
            participatory approach that ensures ownership, and
            accountability; effective monitoring, and project
            performance indicators; and, community involvement in the
            implementation of financial, and accounting processes.
            However, the mid-term review identified some tension, and
            insufficient evidence of positive results with the
            participatory approach. To deal with this issue, the Bank
            agreed to combine the promotion of education, community
            participation, and development of specific investment
            projects, with external technical support.

5080080.trustfund:
TF034299-COLOMBIA - OECS BASIC EDUCATION
            REFORM PROJECTS,TF033602-LAC REGION - HEALTH AND EDUCATION,TF040632-COLUMBIA: RURAL EDUCATION
            PROJECT: EDUCATION FOR PEACE,TF032383-LAC REGION - EDUCATION;HEATLH,TF040609-COLUMBIA-RURAL EDUCATION PROJECT
5080080.majtheme: Social protection and risk management,Rural development,Urban development,Human development

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the
            Antioquia Basic Education Project in Colombia are to 1)
            contribute to the Antioquia's goal of improving student
            learning, access, and school retention among the rural and
            urban poor at-risk-of-violence communities; 2) improve the
            capacity of schools/communities, municipalities, and the
            Department to effectively provide their respective education
            services; and 3) provide lessons for a national strategy to
            support municipal and departmental education management and
            investments. The project has three components: 1) The School
            and Community Strengthening component finances (through
            nonrefundable financial transfers) the development and
            implementation of school improvement plans (SIPs). To
            address equity and institutional capacity concerns,
            information and technical assistance efforts will support
            weaker schools and communities to develop and implement
            their own SIPs. 2) The Municipal Education Management and
            Investments Component finances municipal education plans,
            and provides information and technical assistance to develop
            institutional capacity; and 3) The Departmental Education
            Services component a) strengthens, through training and
            technical assistance, the nonmanagerial functions of the
            Departmental Secretariat of Education (consulting,
            communications, and ex post evaluation); b) consolidates and
            integrates the existing computerized systems and tools for
            education evaluation; c) provides a communication network
            between three levels -the Department, Municipal, and local
            education administration offices- under the most appropriate
            technology for each municipality; and d) finances a
            Department-wide communication strategy to disseminate
            project objectives, as well as lessons learned in
            implementing a national strategy to strengthen departmental
            and municipal management of education.
